strings: <se_high>Jessica: Do you mind explaining to me what we're doing here?
<se_high>Jessica: Sometimes, I don't know what's going on in your head, <hero>.

<se_low>Yangus: One-two-three-five! ♪
Hey, fiddle-dee-dee, ♫
it's a bandit's life for me! ♪

<se_low>Yangus: Come on! Join in!
Nothin' like a good ol' sing-song!
Should make us climb at least three times faster!

<se_def>Angelo: Now look! I've gone and got mud on my boots.
Why did we have to come here anyway?

<se_def>Angelo: Are you some kind of masochist!?
Why don't we just turn back?<page>Angelo: I don't see what's so great about this monster<->infested place. What's the point in trudging up any further?
<se_def>Angelo: I've just about had enough of this. If it gets any worse, I'm going back to the wagon.
<se_high>Jessica: Can you feel that!?
<se_high>Jessica: I sense magic! Powerful magic! It's coming from the mountain and the full moon.
<se_high>Jessica: Look at that wall over there. And the shape of the window... Something's going to happen there. I can feel it.

<se_high>Jessica: Don't ask me how I know. I just do.
We'd better stay here and wait.
We can't leave now.

<se_low>Yangus: Right then, 'ere we are! Eh!?
Ain't ya gonna sit down?
...Oh, I get it!
<se_low>Yangus: We forgot to bring any grub wiv us! No point sittin' down if we ain't got nuffin' to eat!
<se_def>Angelo: Night-time makes poets out of people, you know. Not all of them are good poets, mind.

<se_def>Angelo: ...Me? Well, you know.
Anything to keep the ladies happy.

<se_def>Angelo: Tonight's not the night for that, anyway.
My tongue may be smooth and silver, but so is the moon, and it, I concede, is better to look at.
<se_high>Jessica: The last time we came here, the moonlight cast a shadow of that window on the stone wall over there. And the shadow turned into a doorway...

<se_high>Jessica: It still feels like a dream.
But it was real, wasn't it?
<se_low>Yangus: The air's always nicer up in 'igh places, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: Aaah-haaah, aaah-haaah, aaah, aaah, aaah...
<se_low>Yangus: ...H-Haaaaaargh!
<se_low>Yangus: Phew! I got so caught up in breathin' in that I forgot to breathe out there for a while!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Oh yes! That poet, Ishmahri!

<se_def>Angelo: I forgot to check if he really is a man or not.
Maybe he's actually a woman!
What a missed opportunity!
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.

<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library.
It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says, you know.
<se_high>Jessica: I really hate to say this, but I think coming all the way out here was a big mistake.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go back into town. We can get more information that way. Don't you think?

<se_low>Yangus: Where's that 'arp, eh? I dunno.
Can't see anyfin' like that round 'ere.
<se_low>Yangus: Still, I s'pose we'll come across it sooner or later if we keep ploddin' along.

<se_def>Angelo: Are you trying to break the world record for walking the furthest or something?
I think a bit of focus may be required here. Right?
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!
<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'. We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.
<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv. Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.
<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character? Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.

<se_high>Jessica: Hey. We have a ship now, remember?
It's not like we can't ever come back here again.

<se_high>Jessica: In fact, we can come back whenever we like.
So why don't we hop on the ship and head west now?
<se_low>Yangus: So Dhoulmagus come from Farebury to Maella, and then on to the west over the sea.
<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv! Let's get the ship 'eaded west!
<se_def>Angelo: I heard that the world's biggest casino is over on the western continent.
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe we could just drop in there on our way? Add a bit of interest to this trailing around after Dhoulmagus.<page>Angelo: After all, all work and no play makes Angelo a dull boy.
<se_high>Jessica: So the Moonshadow window didn't appear again. I should've known.

<se_high>Jessica: I mean, I can hardly believe it even happened in the first place. It felt like a dream.
But it was real, wasn't it?

<se_low>Yangus: Don't ya just love the air up 'ere!?
It really clears out the system, eh, guv?
(Cough, cough!)

<se_def>Angelo: Okay, here we are. Right at the top.
Well done. Good for you, <hero>.

<se_def>Angelo: And now let's head straight back down again.
Down we go... Come on!

<se_high>Red: Cor, 'ow many times 'ave I 'eard that, eh?
‘Look at that view! Wot a gem!’ ‘Wot a treasure!’ Pah! Yeah, right!
<se_high>Red: As far as I'm concerned, if I can't get me 'ands round it, it ain't treasure. A view's a view and treasure's treasure!
<se_low>Morrie: Ah, magnifico! The air on the top of the mountain is so fresh. Breathe it in and you feel the GUSTO swell in your bosom, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Si, this is the time for the heavy breathing! When the things are becoming crazy, it is a good idea to stop and take some time to breathe.
